p: 8-deoxylactucin ( 17) ( Fig. 2) is a guaianolide found as a major component of chicory root and it is also common in species of Lactuca. It has been demonstrated that 17 possess anti-inflammatory activity by inhibiting the nuclear transcription factor NF-κB and as a selective inhibitor of COX-2 ( Cavin et al., 2005). An important structural characteristic of 17 is the presence of α-methylene-γ-lactone group and α,β-unsaturated cyclopentenone. Compounds that possess these structures, such as Helenalin, can react with sulfhydryl group of Cys38 in NF-kB and prevent DNA binding ( Lyß et al., 1998; Widen et al., 2017). Thus, 8-deoxylactucin ( 17) could interact with NF-κB by a similar mechanism. No in vivo toxicity studies on 8-deoxylactucin ( 17) have been reported to date.
